intro: Becium cameronii, commonly known as Cameron's becium, is a rare flowering plant native to the rocky habitats of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy, narrow leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid environment. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
